Active businesses.label: Active businesses
Active businesses.subtitle: Businesses with turnover or employment in current year
Active businesses.longDescription: This indicator shows the count of active businesses, in the UK, for 2019 to 2024.
Active businesses.caveats: The starting point for demography is the concept of a population of active businesses in a reference year (t). These are defined as businesses that had either turnover or employment at any time during the reference period. Some of this data has been aggregated and may show differences to other published figures.

Business births.label: Business births
Business births.subtitle: Percentage of businesses newly registered for VAT and/or PAYE
Business births.longDescription: This indicator shows the business births as a percentage of all active businesses, in the UK, for 2019 to 2024.
Business births.caveats: A birth is identified as a business that was present in year t, but did not exist in year t-1 or t-2. Births are identified by making comparison of annual active population files and identifying those present in the latest file, but not the two previous ones. The birth rate is calculated using the number of births as a proportion of the active businesses. Some of this data has been aggregated and may show differences to other published figures.

Business deaths.label: Business deaths
Business deaths.subtitle: Percentage of businesses ceasing activity
Business deaths.longDescription: This indicator shows the business deaths as a percentage of all active businesses, in the UK, for 2019 to 2024.
Business deaths.caveats: A death is defined as a business that was on the active file in year t, but was no longer present in the active file in t+1 and t+2. In order to provide an early estimate of deaths, an adjustment has been made to the latest two years deaths to allow for reactivations. These figures are provisional and subject to revision. The death rate is calculated using the number of deaths as a proportion of the active businesses. Some of this data has been aggregated and may show differences to other published figures.

High growth businesses.label: High growth businesses
High growth businesses.subtitle: Percentage of businesses with an average growth in employment of greater than 20% per year over a three-year period
High growth businesses.longDescription: This indicator shows the high growth businesses as a percentage of active businesses with 10 or more employees, in the UK, for 2019 to 2024.
High growth businesses.caveats: High growth measures all businesses with an average growth in employment of greater than 20%, per annum, over a three-year period. The size threshold used to identify these businesses is that they have 10 or more employees. The rate of high growth businesses is calculated using the number of high growth businesses as a proportion of the active businesses with 10 or more employees. Some of this data has been aggregated and may show differences to other published figures.

One-year survival rate.label: One-year business survival rate
One-year survival rate.subtitle: Percentage of newly born businesses that survived for one year
One-year survival rate.longDescription: This indicator shows the one-year survival rate of UK businesses born from 2019 to 2023.
One-year survival rate.caveats:
A business is deemed to have survived for one year if it is active in terms of employment and/or turnover at any point during the year following its year of birth.

The one‑year business survival rate is calculated as the number of businesses that survive for one year as a proportion of businesses born in the start year.

Some of this data has been aggregated and may show differences to other published figures.

Two-year survival rate.label: Two-year business survival rate
Two-year survival rate.subtitle: Percentage of newly born businesses that survived for two years
Two-year survival rate.longDescription: This indicator shows the two-year survival rate of UK businesses born from 2019 to 2022.
Two-year survival rate.caveats:
A business is deemed to have survived for two years if it is active in terms of employment and/or turnover at any point during the second calendar year following its year of birth.

The two‑year business survival rate is calculated as the number of businesses that survive for two years as a proportion of businesses born in the start year.

Some of this data has been aggregated and may show differences to other published figures.

Three-year survival rate.label: Three-year business survival rate
Three-year survival rate.subtitle: Percentage of newly born businesses that survived for three years
Three-year survival rate.longDescription: This indicator shows the three-year survival rate of UK businesses born from 2019 to 2021.
Three-year survival rate.caveats:
A business is deemed to have survived for three years if it is active in terms of employment and/or turnover at any point during the third calendar year following its year of birth.

The three‑year business survival rate is calculated as the number of businesses that survive for three years as a proportion of businesses born in the start year.

Some of this data has been aggregated and may show differences to other published figures.

Four-year survival rate.label: Four-year business survival rate
Four-year survival rate.subtitle: Percentage of newly born businesses that survived for four years
Four-year survival rate.longDescription: This indicator shows the four-year survival rate of UK businesses born in 2019 and 2020.
Four-year survival rate.caveats:
A business is deemed to have survived for four years if it is active in terms of employment and/or turnover at any point during the fourth calendar year following its year of birth.

The four‑year business survival rate is calculated as the number of businesses that survive for four years as a proportion of businesses born in the start year.

Some of this data has been aggregated and may show differences to other published figures.

Five-year survival rate.label: Five-year business survival rate
Five-year survival rate.subtitle: Percentage of newly born businesses that survived for five years
Five-year survival rate.longDescription: This indicator shows the five-year survival rate of UK businesses born in 2019.
Five-year survival rate.caveats:
A business is deemed to have survived for five years if it is active in terms of employment and/or turnover at any point during the fifth calendar year following its year of birth.

The five‑year business survival rate is calculated as the number of businesses that survive for five years as a proportion of businesses born in the start year.

Some of this data has been aggregated and may show differences to other published figures.
